title: Poster, "Internationale Economisch-Historische Tentoonstelling, Schilderijen, Miniaturen, Gobelins, Documenten, Modellen, Grafiek Enz, Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, 4 Juli-15 Sept. 1929 [International Economic History, Pictures, etc. City Museum, Amsterdam]", 1929
medium: Block print and letterpress on cream wove paper
inscribed: Printed throughout page, INTERNATIONALE/ECONOMICSCH-HISTORISCHE/TENTOONSTELLING/4 JULI/15 SEPT./1929/SCHILDERNIJEN/MINIATUREN/GOBELINS/DOCUMENTEN/MODELLEN/GRAFIEK ENZ/STEDELIJK MUSEUM/AMSTERDAM [INTERNATIONAL/ ECONOMIC-HISTORICAL/EXHIBITION/JULY 4 TO SEPT. 15, 1929/PICTURES/MINIATURES/TAPESTRIES/DOCUMENTS/MODELS/GRAPHICS/STEDELIJK MUSEUM/AMSTERDAM.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of  Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt and Jacob H. Schiff and through bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Decorative letter forms in black and red organized in horizontal and square blocks on gold, red or white fields.  To the right is a large red square field which looks like it is composed of bricks on top of which are scattered small gold squares.  At lower left, a red, black, and gold geometric ornament in form of a swasticka.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Internationale Economisch-Historische Tentoonstelling, Schilderijen, Miniaturen, Gobelins, Documenten, Modellen, Grafiek Enz, Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, 4 Juli-15 Sept. 1929 [International Economic History, Pictures, etc. City Museum, Amsterdam]", 1929.
1929. Block print and letterpress on cream wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of  Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt and Jacob H. Schiff and through bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 2001-7-1.
